englishTranslationText: The	One	Who	created,	and	then	made	proper
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	ne	banā	kar	theek	kiyā

englishTranslationText: And	the	One	Who	kept	proper	measure	and	then	guided.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jis	ne	andāze	par	rakh	kar	rāh	di

englishTranslationText: The	One	Who	produced	pasture.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jis	ne	chāra	nikālā

englishTranslationText: Then	made	it	dry	and	dark.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	usey	khushk	siyāh	kar	diyā

englishTranslationText:
We	shall	now	make	you	read	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	so	
you	will	not	forget.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	ham	tumheñ	padhāyeñg	ki	tum	na	bhoolo	ge

arabicText: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ
englishTranslationText: Except	what	Allah	wills;	indeed	He	knows	all	the	evident	and	all	the	concealed.
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	jo	Allāh	chāhe	be-shak	woh	jāntā	hai	har	khule	aur	chipe	ko.

englishTranslationText: And	We	shall	create	the	means	of	ease	for	you.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ham	tumhāre	liye	āasāni	kā	sāmān	kar	deñ	ge

englishTranslationText: Therefore	advise,	if	advising	is	beneficial.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	tum	nasiḥat	farmāo	agar	nasiḥat	kām	de

englishTranslationText: Soon	whoever	fears	will	heed	advice.
romanUrduTranslationText: An-qareeb	nasiḥat	mane	gā	jo	dartā	hai

englishTranslationText: And	the	most	wicked	will	stay	away	from	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	is	se	woh	badā	bad-bakht	door	rahegā.

englishTranslationText: The	one	who	will	enter	the	biggest	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	sab	se	badi	āg	meiñ	jāyegā.

arabicText: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
englishTranslationText: Then	he	neither	dies	in	it,	nor	lives.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	na	us	meiñ	mare	aur	na	jiye

englishTranslationText: Indeed	successful	is	the	one	who	became	pure.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	murād	ko	pahunchā	jo	sutharā	huā

englishTranslationText: And	who	mentioned	the	name	of	his	Lord,	then	offered	prayer.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	apne	Rab	kā	nām	le	kar	Namāz	pardhi.

englishTranslationText: But	rather	you	prefer	the	life	of	this	world!
romanUrduTranslationText: Balki	tum	jeeti	duniyā	ko	tarjeeḥ	dete	ho

englishTranslationText:
Whereas	the	Hereafter	is	better	and	
everlasting.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Ākhirat	behtar	aur	bāqi	rehne	wāli.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	this	is	in	the	former	scriptures.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	ye	agle	saḥifoñ	meiñ	hai

englishTranslationText: In	the	Books	of	Ibrahim	and	Moosa.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ibrāhim	aur	Mūsā	ke	saḥifoñ	meiñ.

englishTranslationText:
Certainly	the	news	of	the	calamity	that	will	
overwhelm	has	come	to	you!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	tumhāre	pās	us	musibat	ki	khabar	
āyi	jo	chhā	jāyegi

englishTranslationText: Many	a	face	will	be	disgraced	on	that	day.
romanUrduTranslationText: Kitne	hi	muñh	us	din	žaleel	hoñge

englishTranslationText: Labouring,	striving	hard.
romanUrduTranslationText: Kām	kareñ	mashaqqat	jheleñ.

englishTranslationText: (Yet)	Going	into	the	blazing	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jāyeñ	bhadakti	āg	meiñ

englishTranslationText:
Made	to	drink	water	from	the	boiling	hot	
spring.
romanUrduTranslationText: Nihāyat	jalte	chashme	kā	pāni	pilāye	jāyeñ.

arabicText: لَّيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
There	is	no	food	for	them	except	thorns	of	
fire.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	liye	kuch	khānā	nahiñ	magar	āg	ke	
kāñte

arabicText: لَّا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِن جُوعٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Which	neither	give	strength	nor	satisfy	the	
hunger.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ki	na	farbahi	lāyeñ	aur	na	bhook	meiñ	kām	
deñ

englishTranslationText: Many	a	face	will	be	in	serenity	on	that	day.
romanUrduTranslationText: Kitne	hi	muñh	us	din	chain	meiñ	haiñ

englishTranslationText: Rejoicing	over	their	efforts.
romanUrduTranslationText: Apni	koshish	par	rāzi

englishTranslationText: In	a	high	Garden.
romanUrduTranslationText: Buland	bāgh	meiñ.

englishTranslationText: In	which	they	will	not	hear	any	lewd	speech.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	us	meiñ	koyi	behooda	bāt	na	suneñge.

englishTranslationText: In	it	is	a	flowing	spring.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	meiñ	rawāñ	chashma	hai.

englishTranslationText: In	which	are	high	thrones.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	meiñ	buland	takht	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: And	chosen	goblets.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	chune	huye	kooze

englishTranslationText: And	arranged	carpets.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	barābar	barābar	bichhe	huye	qāleen.

englishTranslationText: And	linen	spread	out.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	phaili	huyi	chāñdniyāñ

arabicText: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ
englishTranslationText: So	do	they	not	see	the	camel	–	how	it	has	been	created?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kyā	ooñt	ko	nahiñ	dekhte	kaisā	banāyā	gayā.

englishTranslationText: And	the	heaven	-	how	it	has	been	raised?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	āsmān	ko	kaisā	ooñchā	kiyā	gayā

englishTranslationText: And	the	mountains	-	how	they	have	been	established?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	pahādoñ	ko	kaise	qāim	kiye	gaye.

englishTranslationText: And	the	earth	-	how	it	has	been	spread	out?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	zameen	ko	kaise	bichāyi	gayi.

englishTranslationText:
Therefore	advise;	indeed	you*	are	a	proclaimer	of	advice.	(*The	Holy	Prophet	is	a	Remembrance	
from	Allah.)
romanUrduTranslationText: To	tum	nasiḥat	sunāo	tum	to	yahi	nasiḥat	sunāne	wāle	.ho

englishTranslationText: You	are	not	at	all	a	guardian	over	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	kuch	un	par	kadodā	(nigehbān)	nahiñ

englishTranslationText: Except	whoever	turns	away	and	disbelieves	-
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	jo	muñh	phere	aur	kufr	kare

englishTranslationText: So	Allah	will	mete	out	to	him	the	greatest	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	usey	Allāh	badā	‘ažāb	de	gā

englishTranslationText: Indeed	only	towards	Us	is	their	return
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	hamāri	hi	ṭaraf	un	kā	phirnā	hai

englishTranslationText: Then	indeed	only	upon	Us	is	their	reckoning.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	be-shak	hamāri	hi	ṭaraf	un	kā	ḥisāb	hai

englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	the	(particular)	dawn.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	subḥ	ki	qasam

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	ten	nights.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	das	rātoñ	ki

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	even	and	the	odd.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	juft	aur	ṭāq	ki

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	night	when	it	recedes
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rāt	ki	jab	chal	de

arabicText: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌۭ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
englishTranslationText:
Why	is	there	an	oath	in	this,	for	the	
intelligent?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyuñ	us	meiñ	‘aql	mand	ke	liye	qasam	huyi

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	not	see	how	did	your	Lord	deal	
with	(the	tribe	of)	Aad?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tum	ne	na	dekhā	tumhāre	Rab	ne	Āad	
ke	sāth	kaisā	kiyā.

englishTranslationText: The	tall	giants	of	Iram?
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	Iram	ḥad	se	ziyāda	ṭool	wāle

arabicText: ٱلَّتِى لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ
englishTranslationText:
Like	whom	no	one	else	was	born	in	the	
cities.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	un	jaisā	shahroñ	meiñ	paidā	na	huā

englishTranslationText:
And	the	tribe	of	Thamud,	who	hewed	rocks	
in	the	valley.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Samood	jinhoñ	ne	wādi	meiñ	paththar	
ki	chattāneñ	kātiñ

englishTranslationText: And	with	Firaun,	who	used	to	crucify.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Fir’aun	ki	chaumekhā	kartā	(sakht	
sazāyeñ	detā)

englishTranslationText: Those	who	rebelled	in	the	cities,
romanUrduTranslationText: Jinhoñ	ne	shahroñ	meiñ	sarkashi	ki

englishTranslationText:
And	who	then	spread	a	lot	of	turmoil	in	
them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	un	meiñ	bahut	fasād	phailāyā

englishTranslationText:
Therefore	your	Lord	struck	them	hard	
with	the	means	of	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	un	par	tumhāre	Rab	ne	‘ažāb	kā	kordā	
ba-quwwat	mārā.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	nothing	is	hidden	from	the	sight	of	your	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	tumhāre	rab	ki	nazar	se	kuchh	
ghāib	nahiñ.

arabicText: فَأَمَّا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكْرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَكْرَمَنِ
englishTranslationText:
So	man,	whenever	his	Lord	tests	him	by	giving	him	honour	and	favours	–	thereupon	he	says,	“My	
Lord	has	honoured	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Lekin	āadmi	to	jab	usey	us	kā	Rab	āzmāye	ke	us	ko	jāh	aur	ne’amat	de	jab	to	kahtā	hai	mere	Rab	
ne	mujhe	‘izzat	di.

arabicText: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَهَـٰنَنِ
englishTranslationText: And	if	He	tests	him	and	restricts	his	livelihood	–	thereupon	he	says,	“My	Lord	has	degraded	me!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	agar	āzmāye	aur	us	kā	rizq	us	par	tang	kare	to	kahtā	hai	mere	Rab	ne	mujhe	khwār	kiyā.

englishTranslationText: Not	at	all	–	but	rather	you	do	not	honour	the	orphan.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yuñ	nahiñ	balke	tum	yateem	ki	‘izzat	nahiñ	karte

englishTranslationText: And	do	not	urge	one	another	to	feed	the	needy.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	āpas	meiñ	aik	doosre	ko	miskeen	ke	khilāne	ki	raghbat	nahiñ	dete.

englishTranslationText: And	you	readily	devour	the	inheritance	with	greed.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	mirās	kā	māl	hap	hap	khāte	ho

englishTranslationText: And	you	harbour	intense	love	for	wealth.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	māl	ki	nihāyat	muḥabbat	rakhte	ho

arabicText: كَلَّآ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ دَكًّۭا دَكًّۭا
englishTranslationText: Most	certainly	-	when	the	earth	is	smashed	and	blown	to	bits
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	hāñ	jab	zameen	takrā	kar	pāsh	pāsh	kar	di	jāye

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	command	of	your	Lord	comes	–	and	the	angels	row	by	row
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tumhāre	Rab	kā	ḥukm	āaye	aur	Farishte	qaṭār	qaṭār.

arabicText: وَجِا۟ىٓءَ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	hell	is	brought	that	day	–	on	that	day	will	man	reflect,	but	where	is	the	time	now	to	
think?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	din	Jahannam	lāyi	jāye	us	din	ādmi	sochegā	aur	ab	usey	sochne	kā	waqt	kahāñ

englishTranslationText:
He	will	say,	“Alas	–	if	only	I	had	sent	some	
good	deeds	ahead,	during	my	lifetime!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahegā	hāye	kisi	ṭaraḥ	maiñ	ne	jeete	ji	neki	
āage	bheji	hoti.

englishTranslationText:
So	on	that	day,	no	one	punishes	like	He	
does!		”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	us	din	us	kā	sā	‘ažāb	koyi	nahiñ	kartā.

englishTranslationText: And	no	one	binds	like	He	does!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	kā	sā	bāñdhnā	koyi	nahiñ	bāñdhtā.

englishTranslationText: O	the	contented	soul!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aey	iṭminān	wāli	jān

englishTranslationText:
Return	towards	your	Lord	–	you	being	
pleased	with	Him,	and	He	pleased	with	
you!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apne	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	wāpas	ho	yuñ	ke	tu	us	se	
rāzi	Woh	tujh	se	rāzi.

englishTranslationText:
Then	enter	the	ranks	of	My	chosen	
bondmen!
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	Mere	khās	bandoñ	meiñ	dākhil	ho

englishTranslationText: And	come	into	My	Paradise!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Meri	Jannat	meiñ	āa

englishTranslationText: I	swear	by	this	city	(Mecca)	-
romanUrduTranslationText: Mujhe	is	shahar	ki	qasam

englishTranslationText:
For	you	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	–	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	are	in	this	
city.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ki	aey	Meḥboob	tum	is	shahar	meiñ	
tashreef	farmā	ho

englishTranslationText:
And	by	oath	of	your	forefather	Ibrahim,	
and	by	you	-	his	illustrious	son!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāre	bāp	Ibrāhim	ki	qasam	aur	us	
ki	aulād	ki	ke	tum	ho

englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	created	man	surrounded	
by	hardships.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Ham	ne	ādmi	ko	mashaqqat	meiñ	
rahtā	paidā	kiyā

arabicText: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Does	man	think	that	no	one	will	ever	have	
power	over	him?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā āadmi	ye	samajhtā	hai	ke	hargiz	us	par	
koyi	qudrat	nahiñ	pāyegā

englishTranslationText: He	says,	“I	destroyed	vast	wealth.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kehtā	hai	maiñ	ne	dheroñ	māl	fanā	kar	
diyā

englishTranslationText: Does	man	think	that	no	one	saw	him?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	ādmi	ye	samajhtā	hai	ki	usey	kisi	ne	na	dekhā

englishTranslationText: Did	We	not	make	two	eyes	for	him?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	ham	ne	us	ki	do	āñkheñ	na	banāyiñ

englishTranslationText: And	a	tongue	and	two	lips?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	zabān	aur	do	hoñt

englishTranslationText: And	did	We	not	guide	him	to	the	two	elevated	things?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	usey	do	ubhri	cheezoñ	ki	rāh	batāyi

englishTranslationText: So	he	did	not	quickly	enter	the	valley.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	be-t’ammul	ghāti	meiñ	na	koodā

englishTranslationText: And	what	have	you	understood,	what	the	valley	is!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tu	ne	kyā	jānā	woh	ghāti	kyā	hai

englishTranslationText: The	freeing	of	a	slave!
romanUrduTranslationText: Kisi	bande	ki	garden	churdānā

arabicText: أَوْ إِطْعَـٰمٌۭ فِى يَوْمٍۢ ذِى مَسْغَبَةٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Or	the	feeding	on	a	day	of	hunger.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yā	bhook	ke	din	khānā	denā

englishTranslationText: Of	a	related	orphan,
romanUrduTranslationText: Rishtey	dār	yateem	ko

englishTranslationText: Or	of	a	homeless	needy	person!
romanUrduTranslationText: Yā	khāk	nashin	miskeen	ko.

arabicText: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْمَرْحَمَةِ
englishTranslationText:
And	moreover	to	be	of	those	who	accepted	faith,	and	who	urged	patience	to	one	another	and	who	
urged	graciousness	to	one	another.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	huā	un	se	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	unhoñ	ne	āapas	meiñ	sabr	ki	wasiyyateñ	kiñ	aur	āapas	meiñ	
maharbāni	ki	wasiyyateñ	kiñ

englishTranslationText: These	are	the	people	of	the	right.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ye	dahni	ṭaraf	wāle	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ
englishTranslationText: And	those	who	denied	Our	signs,	are	the	people	of	the	left.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jinhoñ	ne	hamāri	Āyatoñ	se	kufr	kiyā	woh	bāyiñ	ṭaraf	wāle

englishTranslationText: Upon	them	is	a	fire,	in	which	they	are	imprisoned,	closed	and	shut	above	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	par	āg	hai	ke	us	meiñ	dāl	kar	oopar	se	band	kar	di	gayi

englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	the	sun	and	its	light
romanUrduTranslationText: Suraj	aur	us	ki	raushni	ki	qasam.

englishTranslationText:
And	by	oath	of	the	moon	when	it	follows	
the	sun
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	chānd	ki	jab	us	ke	peeche	āaye

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	day	when	it	reveals	it
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	din	ki	jab	usey	chamkāye

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	night	when	it	hides	it
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rāt	ki	jab	usey	chipāye

englishTranslationText:
And	by	oath	of	the	heaven	and	by	oath	of	
Him	Who	made	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	āasmān	aur	us	ke	banāne	wāle	ki	
qasam.

englishTranslationText:
And	by	oath	of	the	earth	and	by	oath	of	Him	
Who	spread	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zameen	aur	us	ke	phailāne	wāle	ki	
qasam.

englishTranslationText:
And	by	oath	of	the	soul	and	by	oath	of	Him	
Who	made	it	proper.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jān	ki	aur	us	ki	jis	ne	usey	theek	
banāyā

englishTranslationText:
And	inspired	in	it	the	knowledge	of	its	sins	
and	its	piety.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	us	ki	badkāri	aur	us	ki	parhez-gāri	dil	
meiñ	dāli

englishTranslationText:
Indeed	successful	is	the	one	who	made	it	
pure.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	murād	ko	pahunchā	jis	ne	usey	
suthrā	kiyā

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	failed	is	the	one	who	covered	
it	in	sin.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	nā-murād	huā	jis	ne	usey	ma’siyat	
meiñ	chipāyā

englishTranslationText: The	tribe	of	Thamud	denied	with	rebellion.
romanUrduTranslationText: Samood	ne	apni	sarkashi	se	jhutlāyā

englishTranslationText:
When	the	most	wicked	among	them	stood	
up	in	defiance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	ke	us	kā	sab	se	bad	bakht	uth	khadā	
huā.

arabicText: فَقَالَ لَهُمْ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقْيَـٰهَا
englishTranslationText:
So	the	Noble	Messenger	of	Allah	said	to	
them,	“Stay	away	from	the	she	camel	of	
Allah,	and	from	its	turn	to	drink.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	un	se	Allāh	ke	Rasool	ne	farmāyā	Allah	
ke	nāqa	aur	us	ki	peene	ki	bāri	se	bacho

arabicText: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمْدَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمْ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
englishTranslationText:
In	response	they	belied	him,	and	hamstrung	the	she	camel	-	so	Allah	put	ruin	over	them	because	
of	their	sins	and	flattened	their	dwellings.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unhoñ	ne	usey	jhutlāyā	phir	nāqa	ki	
koocheñ	kāt	diñ	(pāoñ	kāt	diye)	to	un	par	un	ke	Rab	ne	un	ke	gunāh	ke	sabab	tabāhi	dāl	kar	woh	
basti	barābar	kar	di

englishTranslationText: And	He	does	not	at	all	fear	its	consequences.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	ke	peecha	karne	kā	usey	khauf	nahiñ.
